org.paces.Stata

Class RaschJMLE

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.paces.Stata.RaschJMLE

  • public class RaschJMLE
extends Object
    Version:
    0.0.0

    Class used to fit a Rasch Model to data using the Joint Maximum Likelihood Estimator

    Some equations that may prove useful/helpful when interpreting/understanding some of the parameters are detailed below. These equations are adapted from page 100 of Wright, B. D., & Masters, G . N. (1982). Rating scale analysis: Rasch measurement. Chicago, IL: MESA

    Estimation of Item/Person Parameters and Fit Statistics Under the Rasch Model
    Parameter/Fit Statistic Name Equation Defining the Parameter Expectation Variance
    Observed Response \[\chi_{ij}\] \[\] \[\]
    Expected mean of \(x_{ij}\) \[\omega_{ij} = \sum_{k = 0}^{m_{i}}k\pi_{ijk}\] \[\] \[\]
    Variance of \(x_{ij}\) \[\psi_{ij} = \sum_{k = 0}^{m_{i}} exp\sum_{l = 0}^{k} (\beta_{i} - \delta_{ij})\] \[\] \[\]
    \[\pi_{ijk} = \frac{exp\sum_{l = 0}^{k}(\beta_{i} - \delta_{ij})}{\psi_{ij}}\] \[\] \[\]
    \[\sigma_{ij} = \sum_{k = 0}^{m_{i}}(k - \omega_{ij}) ^{2}\pi_{ijk}\] \[\] \[\]
    Kurtosis of \(x_{ij}\) \[\gamma_{ij} = \sum_{k = 0}^{m_{i}}(k - \omega_{ij}) ^{4}\pi_{ijk}\] \[\] \[\]
    Score Residual \[\xi_{ij} = \chi_{ij} - \omega_{ij}\] \[0\] \[\sigma_{ij}\]
    Standardized Residuals \[\zeta_{ij} = \frac{\xi_{ij}}{\sqrt{\sigma_{ij}}}\] \[0\] \[1\]
    Score Residual Squared \[\xi_{ij}^{2} = \sigma_{ij}\zeta_{ij}^{2}\] \[\sigma_{ij}\] \[\lambda_{ij} - \sigma_{ij}^{2}\]
    Standardized Residual Squared \[\zeta_{ij}^{2}\] \[1\] \[(\frac{\lambda_{ij}}{\sigma_{ij}^{2}}) - 1\]
    Unweighted Mean Square Error (Outfit) \[\varepsilon_{i} = \frac{\sum_{j = 1}^{J}\zeta_{ij}^{2}}{J}\] \[1\] \[\sum_{j}^{J}(\frac{\gamma_{ij}}{\sigma_{ij}^{2}}) / \frac{J^{2} - 1}{J}\]
    Weighted Mean Squared Error (Infit) \[\eta_{i} = \frac{\sum_{j = 1}^{J}\sigma_{ij}\zeta_{ij}^{2}}{\sum_{j}^{J}\sigma_{ij}}\] \[1\] \[\omicron_{i}^{2} = \frac{\sum_{j}^{J} (\gamma_{ij} - \sigma_{ij}^{2})}{(\sum_{j}^{J}\sigma_{ij})^{2}}\]
    \[ = \frac{\sum_{j}^{J}\xi_{ij}^{2}}{\sum_{j}^{J}\sigma_{ij}}\]
    Standardized Weighted Mean Squared Error (Std. Infit) \[\tau_{i} = (\eta_{i}^{1/3} - 1)(\frac{3}{\omicron_{i}}) + (\frac{\omicron_{i}}{3})\] \[0\] \[1\]
    Author:
    Billy Buchanan

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      double adjustment
      Parameter used to adjust extreme scores (e.g., perfect failures/successes) This value defaults to 0.3 if no user-specified value is passed to the Stata program that calls this Java program.
      boolean centeritems
      Sets a boolean in the estimation algorithm to center the item parameters.
      double[] diff
      A double array of estimated difficulty parameter values.
      double[] diffSE
      An array of standard errors of the difficulty parameter estimates from the JMLE values obtained from fitting the Rasch model to the data.
      double globalconverge
      The Global Maximum Likelihood convergence criteria.
      int globaliterations
      The number of Maximum Likelihood Iterations to use for the model overall.
      double intercept
      Parameter used for DefaultLinearTransformation Documentation from com.itemanalysis.psychometrics not clear.
      com.itemanalysis.psychometrics.irt.model.ItemResponseModel[] irm
      An Array of Item Response Models from the com.itemanalysis .psychometrics package
      double[] itemInfit
      An array of double valued estimates of item-level weighted mean squares errors - or InFit - statistics.
      double[] itemOutfit
      An array of double valued estimates of item-level unweighted mean squares errors - or OutFit - statistics.
      double[] itemStdInfit
      An array of double valued estimates of item-level standardized weighted mean squares errors - or Standardized InFit - statistics.
      double[] itemStdOutfit
      An array of double valued estimates of item-level standardized unweighted mean squares errors - or Standardized OutFit - statistics.
      com.itemanalysis.psychometrics.irt.estimation.JointMaximumLikelihoodEstimation jmle
      Joint Maximum Likelihood Estimator as implemented in the com .itemanalysis.psychometrics package (http://www.github .com/meyerjp3/psychometrics).
      double personconverge
      The maximum likelihood convergence criteria for the estimation of person parameter theta.
      List<Double> personInfit
      An array of double valued estimates of person-level weighted mean squares errors - or InFit - statistics.
      int personiterations
      The number of Maximum Likelihood Iterations to use for the estimation of person parameter theta.
      List<Double> personOutfit
      An array of double valued estimates of person-level unweighted mean squares errors - or OutFit - statistics.
      double[] personStandardErrors
      An array containing the conditional standard error of measurement values for the person parameter theta estimates following fitting the Rasch model with the JMLE estimator.
      List<Double> personStdInfit
      An array of double valued estimates of person-level standardized weighted mean squares errors - or Standardized InFit - statistics.
      List<Double> personStdOutfit
      An array of double valued estimates of person-level standardized unweighted mean squares errors - or Standardized OutFit - statistics.
      List<com.itemanalysis.psychometrics.irt.estimation.RaschFitStatistics> pfstats
      List object to store person fit statistics
      int precision
      Parameter used when defining the precision to use with the printScoreTable method.
      Double[][] residuals
      Estimated residual error from individual item responses
      double scale
      Parameter used for DefaultLinearTransformation Documentation from com.itemanalysis.psychometrics not clear.
      byte[][] thedata
      An m x n matrix of item responses where m = persons and n = items
      double[] theta
      A double array containing the estimated values of the trait across persons.

      com.itemanalysis.psychometrics.irt.model.ItemResponseModel[] getIRM()
      Getter method for the array of Item Response Models.
      double[] getItemInfit()
      Method to access the estimated item-level infit statistics The item infit (or the Information Weighted Mean Square error) is defined as : \(v_i = \sum_{j}^{J}W_{ij}z_{ij}^{2} / \sum_{j}^{J}W_{ij} \) Where \(W_{ij}\) is the variance of the ith person and jth item: \(W_{ij} = \sum_{k = 0}^{m_{i}}(k - \varepsilon_{ij})^{2}\pi_{ijk}\) and \(z_{ij}\) is the residual on the jth item for the ith subject.
      double getItemInfit(int idx)
      Method to access the estimated item infit statistic for the jth item
      double[] getItemOutfit()
      Method to access the estimated item-level outfit statistics The item outfit (or the Unweighted Mean Square error) is defined as: \(u_{i} = \sum_{n = 1}^{N}z_{ij}^{2} / N \) Where \(z_{ij}^{2}\) is the squared residual for the ith subject responding to the jth item and N is the number of subjects.
      double getItemOutfit(int idx)
      Method to access the estimated item outfit statistic for the jth item
      double[] getItemStdInfit()
      Method to access the estimated standardized item infit statistics
      double getItemStdInfit(int idx)
      Method to access the estimated standardized item infit statistic for the jth item

      Method to access the estimated standardized item outfit statistics

      Method to access the estimated standardized item outfit statistic for the jth item

      Method that returns item fit statistics to Stata This method sets the item fit statistics as Stata scalars which will be further processed by the .ado file to provide better return objects.
      void returnPersonParameters()
      Method to return Person fit statistics to Stata This method adds six new variables to the dataset: theta, csem, outfit, infit, stdoutfit, and stdinfit.
      void returnResiduals()
      Method returns residuals as a set of scalars which will need to be further processed by Stata in order to construct the matrix of residuals.

      Method to set adjustment factor for extreme scores If no user-specified value is passed, the method sets this parameter to a default value of 0.3.

    • Field Detail

      • thedata

        public byte[][] thedata
        An m x n matrix of item responses where m = persons and n = items

      • residuals

        public Double[][] residuals
        Estimated residual error from individual item responses

      • adjustment

        public double adjustment
        Parameter used to adjust extreme scores (e.g., perfect failures/successes) This value defaults to 0.3 if no user-specified value is passed to the Stata program that calls this Java program.

      • intercept

        public double intercept
        Parameter used for DefaultLinearTransformation Documentation from com.itemanalysis.psychometrics not clear. Will default to a value of 1.0 if no user specified value is passed.

      • scale

        public double scale
        Parameter used for DefaultLinearTransformation Documentation from com.itemanalysis.psychometrics not clear. Will default to a value of 1.0 if no user specified value is passed.

      • precision

        public int precision
        Parameter used when defining the precision to use with the printScoreTable method. Sets a default of 3 if nothing passed by the user

      • globaliterations

        public int globaliterations
        The number of Maximum Likelihood Iterations to use for the model overall. This value is set by the Stata local macro 'giter' and if null will default to a value of 5,000.

      • globalconverge

        public double globalconverge
        The Global Maximum Likelihood convergence criteria. Set by the Stata local macro 'gconv'. If the local macro is null this parameter is set to a default of 0.0001.

      • personiterations

        public int personiterations
        The number of Maximum Likelihood Iterations to use for the estimation of person parameter theta. This value is set by the Stata local macro 'piter' and if null will default to a value of 2,500.

      • personconverge

        public double personconverge
        The maximum likelihood convergence criteria for the estimation of person parameter theta. Value is set by the Stata local macro 'pconv' and if null is set to a default of 0.0001.

      • centeritems

        public boolean centeritems
        Sets a boolean in the estimation algorithm to center the item parameters. The value is set by the Stata local macro 'centitems' and if null will set the boolean to false, if active it sets the boolean to true.

      • theta

        public double[] theta
        A double array containing the estimated values of the trait across persons. This can be thought of as an m x 1 vector of estimates where theta is assumed to be N(0, 1).

      • diff

        public double[] diff
        A double array of estimated difficulty parameter values. Since the Rasch model constrains the discrimination parameter to 1, the only item parameter that is freely estimated is the difficulty of the items . This corresponds to the location where the probability of a correct response to the item j is 0.5.

      • personStandardErrors

        public double[] personStandardErrors
        An array containing the conditional standard error of measurement values for the person parameter theta estimates following fitting the Rasch model with the JMLE estimator.

      • diffSE

        public double[] diffSE
        An array of standard errors of the difficulty parameter estimates from the JMLE values obtained from fitting the Rasch model to the data.

      • itemInfit

        public double[] itemInfit
        An array of double valued estimates of item-level weighted mean squares errors - or InFit - statistics.

      • itemOutfit

        public double[] itemOutfit
        An array of double valued estimates of item-level unweighted mean squares errors - or OutFit - statistics.

      • itemStdInfit

        public double[] itemStdInfit
        An array of double valued estimates of item-level standardized weighted mean squares errors - or Standardized InFit - statistics.

      • itemStdOutfit

        public double[] itemStdOutfit
        An array of double valued estimates of item-level standardized unweighted mean squares errors - or Standardized OutFit - statistics.

      • personInfit

        public List<Double> personInfit
        An array of double valued estimates of person-level weighted mean squares errors - or InFit - statistics.

      • personOutfit

        public List<Double> personOutfit
        An array of double valued estimates of person-level unweighted mean squares errors - or OutFit - statistics.

      • personStdInfit

        public List<Double> personStdInfit
        An array of double valued estimates of person-level standardized weighted mean squares errors - or Standardized InFit - statistics.

      • personStdOutfit

        public List<Double> personStdOutfit
        An array of double valued estimates of person-level standardized unweighted mean squares errors - or Standardized OutFit - statistics.

      • setAdjustment

        public void setAdjustment()
        Method to set adjustment factor for extreme scores If no user-specified value is passed, the method sets this parameter to a default value of 0.3. For additional information on adjusting for extreme scores, see http://www.winsteps .com/facetman/xtremescore.htm.

        public void setPersonIterations()

      • setCenterItems

        public void setCenterItems()
        A Setter method for the estimation parameter to center the estimated item parameters When true, items are centered at \(\mu_{\alpha}\) to aid in the identification of the model; this is the standard practice for Rasch modeling. If false, person parameters are centered around \(\mu_{\theta}\).

      • setIntercept

        public void setIntercept()
        Setter method for the intercept member variable Used to scale parameter estiamtes/score estimates. Scaling is the equivalent of : \(Y_{s2} = \alpha + \betaY_{s1}\) Where \(Y_{s2}\) is the transformed value, \(Y_{s1}\) is the raw value, \(\alpha\) is the value passed to the intercept parameter (or 0 .0), and \(\beta\) is the value passed to the scale parameter (or 1.0).

      • setScale

        public void setScale()
        Setter method for the scale member variable Used to scale parameter estiamtes/score estimates. Scaling is the equivalent of : \(Y_{s2} = \alpha + \betaY_{s1}\) Where \(Y_{s2}\) is the transformed value, \(Y_{s1}\) is the raw value, \(\alpha\) is the value passed to the intercept parameter (or 0 .0), and \(\beta\) is the value passed to the scale parameter (or 1.0).

        public void setPrecision()

      • fitModel

        public void fitModel()
        A method to fit the model to the data; This method also sets some of the variables of the class. This method fits the Rasch model to the data in memory. The PROX procedure is used for initial item estimates. This is equivalent to: \(d_i^o = x_i - x_.\) where \(x_i = ln( (1 - P_i) / P_i ) \) and \(x_. = \sum_{i}x_i/J\) . Here, \(P_i = \sum_{i = 1}^{N}item_j/((m)(N))\) where m denotes the number of response categories, N denotes the number of subjects, the subscript j is used to index an individual item, and J is the number of items. Additionally, the item variance can be estimated as: \(\sigma^2 = (\sum_{i}x_i^2 - Jx_.^2)/(J - 1)\)

      • printStats

        public void printStats()
        Method used to Print results to Stata Console This method prints general results from the estimation algorithm to the Stata console. Frequency tables are suppressed to save space on the screen since these results are easily obtained by iterating over the items and calling the tabulate function in Stata.

      • printStandard

        public void printStandard()
        Default print method excludes the person parameter output to conserve a bit of screen real estate.

        public void printItems()
        Prints data related to item statistics to the console

      • setPersonFitStatistics

        public void setPersonFitStatistics()
        Method used to set all Person Fit Statistics This method is used to set person outfit, infit, standardized outfit, and standardized infit values after JMLE estimation of a Rasch IRT model. To access these data from Stata, see the return methods below.

        Method to get the double objects with the estimated infit statistic for the ith subject

        idx - The index value to identify the ith subject
        Returns:
        A double type object containing estimated person-level infit statistic for the ith subject

      • returnPersonParameters

        public void returnPersonParameters()
        Method to return Person fit statistics to Stata This method adds six new variables to the dataset: theta, csem, outfit, infit, stdoutfit, and stdinfit. These store person-level fit statistics estimated while fitting the model to the data. Item-level fit statistics are returned using a different method (see below for additional information).

      • setItemFitStatistics

        public void setItemFitStatistics()
        Method used to set all Item Fit Statistics This method is used to set item level outfit, infit, standardized outfit, and standardized infit values after JMLE estimation of a Rasch IRT model. To access these data from Stata, see the return methods below. The unweighted mean square error (outfit) is defined as: \(u_i = \sum_{n = 1}^{N}z_{ni}^2 / N\) Where \(z_{ni} = \epsilon_{ni} / \sqrt{W_{ni}} \) which is the standardized residual on the ith item for the nth person, and \( W_{ni} = \sum_{k = 0}^{m}(k - E_{ni})^2 \pi_{nik}\) or the variance of the response.

      • setResiduals

        public void setResiduals()
        Method to set values of residual object

        Populates the values of the residuals member variable with double precision differences between the expected probability of a correct response and the observed response. These residuals are subsequently used in the estimation of both person and item fit statistics. Residuals here are defined as:

        \(\varepsilon_{ij} = Y_{ij} - \sum_{k = 0}^{m}k\pi_{ijk}\)

        Where \(\pi_{ijk}\) represents the modeled probability of the ith subject selecting the kth category on the jth item and \(Y_{ij}\) is the observed response on the jth item from the ith subject.

      • getDiff

        public double[] getDiff()
        Method to access the estimated item difficulty parameters
        Returns:
        An array of real valued numbers containing the coefficients for the difficulty parameters

      • getDiff

        public double getDiff(int idx)
        Method to access the estimated item difficulty parameter for the jth item
        Parameters:
        idx - An index value to identify the jth item
        Returns:
        A real number with the estimated coefficient on the difficulty parameter for the jth item.

      • getDiffSE

        public double[] getDiffSE()
        Method to access the estimated standard error of the difficulty parameter estimates
        Returns:
        An array of real valued numbers containing the standard errors on the difficulty parameter estimates

      • getDiffSE

        public double getDiffSE(int idx)
        Method to access the estimated item difficulty standard error for the jth item
        Parameters:
        idx - An index value to identify the jth item
        Returns:
        A real number with the estimated standard error on the difficulty parameter estimate for the jth item.

      • getItemInfit

        public double[] getItemInfit()
        Method to access the estimated item-level infit statistics The item infit (or the Information Weighted Mean Square error) is defined as : \(v_i = \sum_{j}^{J}W_{ij}z_{ij}^{2} / \sum_{j}^{J}W_{ij} \) Where \(W_{ij}\) is the variance of the ith person and jth item: \(W_{ij} = \sum_{k = 0}^{m_{i}}(k - \varepsilon_{ij})^{2}\pi_{ijk}\) and \(z_{ij}\) is the residual on the jth item for the ith subject.
        Returns:
        An array of real valued numbers containing estimated item-level infit statistics for all items

      • getItemInfit

        public double getItemInfit(int idx)
        Method to access the estimated item infit statistic for the jth item
        Parameters:
        idx - An index value to identify the jth item
        Returns:
        A real number with the estimated infit statistic for the jth item.

      • getItemOutfit

        public double[] getItemOutfit()
        Method to access the estimated item-level outfit statistics The item outfit (or the Unweighted Mean Square error) is defined as: \(u_{i} = \sum_{n = 1}^{N}z_{ij}^{2} / N \) Where \(z_{ij}^{2}\) is the squared residual for the ith subject responding to the jth item and N is the number of subjects. In other words, this is the average sum of squared person x item residuals.
        Returns:
        An array of real valued numbers containing estimated item-level outfit statistics for all items

      • getItemOutfit

        public double getItemOutfit(int idx)
        Method to access the estimated item outfit statistic for the jth item
        Parameters:
        idx - An index value to identify the jth item
        Returns:
        A real number with the estimated outfit statistic for the jth item.

      • getItemStdInfit

        public double[] getItemStdInfit()
        Method to access the estimated standardized item infit statistics
        Returns:
        An array of real valued numbers containing estimated standardized item-level infit statistics for all items

      • getItemStdInfit

        public double getItemStdInfit(int idx)
        Method to access the estimated standardized item infit statistic for the jth item
        Parameters:
        idx - An index value to identify the jth item
        Returns:
        A real number with the estimated standardized infit statistic for the jth item.

      • getItemStdOutfit

        public double[] getItemStdOutfit()

      • getResiduals

        public double getResiduals(int obid,
                           int varid)
        Method used to obtain a single residual value for the ith person on the jth item.
        Parameters:
        obid - Index for the ith person
        varid - Index for the jth item
        Returns:
        A real valued difference between the observed and expected response of the ith subject to the jth item.

      • returnResiduals

        public void returnResiduals()
        Method returns residuals as a set of scalars which will need to be further processed by Stata in order to construct the matrix of residuals.

      • returnItemParameters

        public void returnItemParameters()
        Method that returns item fit statistics to Stata This method sets the item fit statistics as Stata scalars which will be further processed by the .ado file to provide better return objects.
